message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++){
  JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
  Iterator<String> keysIterator = jsonObject.keys();
  while (keysIterator.hasNext()) {
    String key = keysIterator.next();
    String value = jsonObject.getString(key);
    System.out.println(key + value);
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the keys() method of JSONObject to get an iterator of all the keys in the current object. Then, you can use the getString() method to get the value corresponding to each key. Loop through the keys and append both the key and value to the desired output.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++) {
                JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
                Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
                while (keys.hasNext()) {
                    String key = keys.next();
                    String value = jsonObject.get(key).toString();
                    System.out.print(key + value);
                }
            }
<<<explanation>>>: In order to achieve the desired output, you can use the Iterator next method to iterate through the keys of each JSONObject. Inside the loop, you can retrieve the value corresponding to each key and concatenate them to get the desired string representation.

<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++){
  JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
  Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
  while (keys.hasNext()){
    String key = keys.next();
    String value = jsonObject.getString(key);
    System.out.print(key);
    System.out.print(value);
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: To get the keys and values separately from each object in the JSONArray, you can use the keys() method of the JSONObject class to get an Iterator over the keys. Then, you can iterate through the keys and use getString() method to get the corresponding values. Print the key and value in the desired format.

<<<api>>>: JSONObject
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++){
    JSONObject object = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
    Iterator<String> keys = object.keys();
    
    while(keys.hasNext()){
        String key = keys.next();
        String value = object.getString(key);
        System.out.println(key + value);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: 
You can use the JSONObject.keys() method to get an iterator over the keys of the JSONObject. Then, you can iterate over the keys and use JSONObject.getString(key) to get the value associated with each key.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++){
    JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
    Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
    while(keys.hasNext()){
        String key = keys.next();
        String value = jsonObject.getString(key);
        System.out.println(key + value);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: To get the string representation of key-value pairs for each object separately, you can use the Iterator.next method to iterate over the keys of each JSONObject. Iterate over the jsonArray, get each JSONObject using jsonArray.getJSONObject(i), and then use jsonObject.keys() to get an iterator for the keys. Use Iterator.next() to get each key, and then use jsonObject.getString(key) to get the corresponding value. Print the concatenated string of key and value to get the desired output.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++){
                Iterator<String> iterator = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i).keys();
                while (iterator.hasNext()){
                    String key = iterator.next();
                    String value = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i).getString(key);
                    System.out.print(key + value);
                }
            }
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator to iterate over the keys of each JSONObject in the JSONArray. Then, you can get the corresponding value using getString(key) method.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++) {
  JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
  Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
  while(keys.hasNext()) {
    String key = keys.next();
    String value = jsonObject.getString(key);
    System.out.print(key + value);
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the for loop, you can access each JSONObject using jsonArray.getJSONObject(i). Then, you can retrieve the keys using jsonObject.keys() which returns an Iterator of all the keys in the JSONObject. Finally, you can iterate through the keys using a while loop and get the corresponding values using jsonObject.getString(key).

<<<api>>>: JSONArray.getJSONObject(int index)
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++){
            JSONObject object = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
            Iterator<String> keys = object.keys();
            while(keys.hasNext()){
                String key = keys.next();
                String value = object.getString(key);
                System.out.println(key + value);
            }
        }
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the `keys()` method of JSONObject to get an iterator over the keys in the object. Then, you can use this iterator to get the key-value pairs for each object separately.

<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++) {
                JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
                Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
                while (keys.hasNext()) {
                    String key = keys.next();
                    String value = jsonObject.getString(key);
                    System.out.println(key + value);
                }
            }
<<<explanation>>>: In each iteration of the for loop, you can get the JSONObject at the current index using jsonArray.getJSONObject(i). Then, you can get an iterator of all the keys in the JSONObject using jsonObject.keys(). Finally, you iterate over the keys using a while loop and get the corresponding value for each key using jsonObject.getString(key). You can then print the key and value or store them as per your requirements.
